column2: A Vampire reduced and twisted to savagery, Vargheists swoop in from above and rip battle lines to pieces.
When the souls are released, they endeavour not to return without new victims to torment for eternity.
Lord Mazdamundi is the oldest and most powerful of the living Slann Mage-Priests. At the Dawn of Creation, he was instructed by none other than Lord Kroak himself.
A charge so devastating that it rends the flesh and bone from its victims.
Chaos Marauders are the rank and file of Chaos armies, perfectly placed in the centre of battle, bloodied-weapon in hand.
Great weapons increase the chances that the ambitious, yet lowly, Marauder may ensnare the attention of the Gods.
Increases Winds of Magic power reserve||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]Skaven corruption||Increases Plague Priest rank on recruitment

That Lord Skrolk walks the world is an affront to nature and a sign of the power of the Great Horned Rat. Plants wither and die where Skrolk treads, and the very air about him seems to congeal and darken, as if stained by his baleful presence.
A hippogryph is no easy prize, but its power in battle makes the effort to tame one worth it.
Though temperamental, a successful Razorgor Chariot charge causes horrendous damage to the enemy line.

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Reduces own army's {{tr:icon_money}}recruitment costs||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_untainted]][[/img]]Untainted corruption

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_damage.png]][[/img]]weapon strength||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Reduces own army's {{tr:icon_money}}recruitment costs||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_untainted]][[/img]]Untainted corruption
This ancient, revered beast is a fearsome sight on the battlefield - their giant blowpipes causing much destruction.
Heinrich Kemmler burns with the need for power. Having recognised the limits that mortality placed upon him in his early years, Kemmler made it his life's work to escape them.
From above, the bomber pilot releases a payload of high-yield explosives that wreak havoc on enemy lines.
This cloak is made from the skin of the fierce Dragon Fyrskar - it is now an heirloom of Karak Kadrin and a symbol of vows already fulfilled.
The bow is as natural to the High Elves as breathing; each shot is a masterpiece of death from afar.
The bow is as natural to the High Elves as breathing; each shot is a masterpiece of death from afar.
Berserkers fight with the strength of madmen and an absolute disregard for their own lives.
Equipped with the best armour and weapons, Reiksguard deliver a powerful charge then remain amongst the throng to continue fighting.

Daughter of the mad Count Otto von Drak, Isabella is much like many of her noble counterparts. She is vain, immoral and selfish, and cares little for anything that does not affect her personal comfort or standing.
These riders never tire and can chase foes down over countless leagues, until their dying moment.
The Siren of the Storm’s tortured soul vengefully roams the world’s seas, singing her paralysing songs of death.
The thudding crossbow bolts pack a punch that can bring down most foes.
Preferred lore of Plague Priests, the Spells of Plague are a vile selection that can hurt a lot of the enemy at once. Perfect for when you’re facing hordes of lightly-armoured troops.
Before Grimnir disappeared into the north, he gifted his son, Morgrim, one of his legendary axes. It has been passed down to each High King ever since.
Orc Boyz lack the strength of Big 'Uns, but their tenacity and endurance in battle is well respected.

Reduces [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero action success chance||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence||Improves [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_ward_save.png]][[/img]]ward saves & [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_fire.png]][[/img]]fire resistance||Improves wound recovery time
This twisted and enraged beast is a terrifying totem of might and power.
Devoted to the God of the Sea, Alberic and his elite, seafaring Knights rule the coastline with absolute authority.
He who undertakes the quest must never flinch and never waver, until at last he finds the sacred Grail, and sups.
The crude twin blades wielded by Azhag the Slaughterer are known as Slagga’s Slashas, but who is Slagga?

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_charge_bonus.png]][[/img]]charge bonus||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption||Improves [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order locally
No one knows much about Grimgor before he staggered out of the Blasted Wastes with the Immortulz, his bloody-minded bodyguard. Even for a Black Orc, Grimgor's thirst for war is exceptional.
Shaped in the Daemon-forges of Zharr-Naggrund, Grimgor's mighty axe, Gitsnik, has never grown dull despite its constant use.
Khalida Neferher, the Warrior-Queen of Lybaras, is highly respected across all the lands of Nehekhara. Her intelligence and bravery are as legendary as her intense sense of honour and justice.
The standard, hardy warriors of the Lizardmen battleline. Their clubs are inelegant, but effective.
Holding the line against the enemy charge, braced with shields and fierce with primordial determination.
The most ancient of Dragons, they destroy the foe with a power that can halt Chaos itself.
Agile and deadly in melee - an excellent first-response to impending threats.
A weapon from the College of Light, Luminarks vaporise enemies with pure energy by channelling the Wind of Hysh.
When these Chariots ride to war, there is little that can stand in the way of their terrific charge.
Warpstone fire belches forth, reducing targets to nothing more than bubbling, crusted blobs.
Savage Orcs lay into their enemies with clubs, axes or whatever is needed to cause as much damage as possible.

Developed over millennia by the Mortuary Cult, this lore invokes the desert gods and includes many augment spells to improve the quality of your skeletal warriors, as well as curse the foe and summon extra recruits from the sands.
The touch of an aged Phoenix is enough to freeze a warrior to death.
Chariots are best employed to deliver destructive charges to the enemy lines - over and over again.
This ancient sword, forged to slay Daemons in the earliest days of Aenarion’s rule, burns with the captured fire of the sun.

Morathi's entire existence has been one of scheming and manipulation. Who knows how many of Aenarion's darker deeds sprang from seeds she planted within his mind, or how the history of the Elves might have been different had he not taken her as wife?
Tremble at their imposing sight, run in vain from their mighty arrows.
The physical embodiment of the everlasting gods; curse ye all men who look upon their divine forms!
Rejoice! For a Knight of Bretonnia provides your shield…
Raining slingshots down then vanishing again, too quickly to be caught; a frustrating nuisance to the foe.
Chariots deliver explosive charges to the front lines; the wolf steeds that draw them are ferocious in battle.
Blessed by the God of the Sun, the sword's white-hot edge is infused with the desert's baking heat, setting the air itself ablaze and blinding the foe.
A pack of Dire Wolves is a lacerating mess of teeth in the melee, effective against enemy infantry.
A pack of Dire Wolves is a lacerating mess of teeth in the melee, effective against enemy infantry.
Young and impetuous, these Dragons dive down onto enemy ranks with exuberant fury, crushing foes like flies.
Stealthy and steadfast, these redoubtable Rangers carry both throwing and great axes – the latter for dealing with the more ‘imposing’ opponents.
No cave is too dark, no pathway too treacherous for the Ranger to scout and scour and know.
Whenever this blade tastes blood, its wielder seems to exert greater control over the Winds of Magic.
This mace has a life of its own; it strikes out with lightning speed to bite enemy weapons before a blow is struck.
The greatest way to deliver toxic scourge is to hurl it at the enemy from a very safe distance!
Mutations of the frozen north enable them to freeze their unfortunate victims with their foul, icy breath.
Patchwork creations of pure brawn and unthinking rage, they charge with the desire only to destroy.
More stalwart and powerful than even the riders atop them, demigryphs deliver a monstrous charge into enemy battle lines.
More stalwart and powerful than even the riders atop them, Demigryphs deliver a monstrous charge into enemy battle lines.
A powerful flurry of knots and branches, striking out in the midst of the battle; the will of the forest made real.
The strongest of souls gather the forest around them and are reborn as instruments of its defence.
Untamed Cold Ones are far too unpredictable to be ridden into battle; simply point them at the foe and stay out of their way!
A boar-mounted Savage Orc Big ‘Un has a powerful charge and a really unpleasant line in melee skills.
The Dammaz Kron recounts every deed of infamy perpetuated against the Dwarfs, scribed in the blood of kings and infused with vows of vengeance.

Reduces [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero action success chance||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence, [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_ward_save.png]][[/img]]ward saves & [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_magic.png]][[/img]]magic resistance||Improves wound recovery time||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_untainted]][[/img]]Untainted corruption
This evil weapon entraps the souls of those it cleaves, binding their fleshless remains in servitude.
This beast's bite brings not just pain, but also a cruel toxicity that courses through every vein.
A well-placed kennel of Warhounds, set loose on the enemy lines, can thread injury and debilitating poison amongst the enemy.
A pack of Chaos Warhounds charging, full of bloodlust and with jaws wide, creates no purer sense of terror.
This beast's bite brings not just pain, but also a cruel toxicity that courses through every vein.
Halberdiers are stalwart defenders, able to hold the line behind a wall of Halberds, cutting enemies to ribbons.
Surprise is the greatest of weapons, enabling the stealthy to strike first and hardest, and tip the odds in their favour.
The Shadow Warriors of Nagarythe are grim soldiers who fight for revenge alone.

Da Little Waaagh! is a sneaky, cunning and nasty lore practiced by even nastier Goblin Shamans. The spells are vindictive, lacking the punch of the ‘bigga magicks’ used by Orcs, but can be no less effective due to their sustained effects.
From great range, a Steam Tank launches powerful shots of armour-piercing cannon fire with tremendous stopping power.
Alith Anar is the Shadow King, a revenant who seeks the grisly death of every Dark Elf in retribution for Malekith’s sins.
Frost-Wyrms dwell in lairs below the frozen tundra, still as death until ascending for murderous activities.
These desiccated husks remember how to shoot; a hail of endless death to thin the foe's numbers.
Although Bretonnian warriors are not particularly skilful they can defend a Lord's lands well enough.

The Lore of Fire has its basis in powerful ranged attack spells, designed to wreak massive damage on your foes. If you see your Wizards as essentially 'magical artillery' then the Lore of Fire is probably the one for you.

Life and nature are inextricably linked, when not corrupted by the venomous tendrils of eternal darkness. Life magic is therefore focused on healing and regeneration; the followers of Ghyran use their powers to heal rifts and mend that which is broken, slowing the advancing tide of Chaotic madness and death.
These rabid beasts are the ideal raiding companions, more vicious in death than they ever were in life.
Their bolts strike with such force that, should their targets survive, they are unfit to live even as slaves.
Fired from a catapult with crude wings strapped to his arms, the cackling Goblin pilot guides himself to a messy, pointy-hatted impact.
These Lizardmen riders swoop down upon the enemy lines to harass them from above.
These Lizardmen riders swoop down upon the enemy lines to harass them from above.
The Circlet of Iron, said to be older than the Elven race, is a potent source of arcane power.
Improves magic item drop chance||Reduces miscast base chance||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_untainted]][[/img]]Untainted corruption
Amongst its enemies, a Varghulf is a savage whirl of limbs and claws, devastating in melee.
The Second Everchosen, Vangel, trapped the Greater Daemon U'zuhl inside this regicidal blade.
Wielding double-handed swords and wearing heavy plate, Greatswords are a potent elite unit with an impressive melee strength.
Half-mad, swinging their censers violently and damning all those nearby to a pestilent demise.
Created by the warrior mage, Fredrik von Tarnus, the Silver Seal wards away harmful blows and fell sorceries.
Effectively several crowns in one, this regal headdress instils Settra's unyielding will within those nearby who serve him.
Black Orcs are more disciplined, armoured and deadly than other Orcs, ripping through enemies with their heavy weapons for fun.

Kroq-Gar is an ancient Saurus, the last remaining warrior from the now ruined temple-city of Xhotl. The spawning that brought him into the world also produced a handful of other Saurus, each marked for greatness.

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence||Reduces own army's upkeep {{tr:icon_money}}costs||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_untainted]][[/img]]Untainted corruption
Longbeards are veteran fighters of many wars, rending armour with the two-handed az and cleaving opponents in two.
Hexwraiths charge, spectral, through mountains in search of their prey - a battle line is a trifling thing for their devastating attack.
Scourge is a leathal whip, wrapped in the bitter curses of many generations of Bray-Shamans.
The Hellcannon artillery has a deadly sentience, firing bolts of eldritch fury over great distances.
More reliable than others of their class, a blowpipe-primed unit can fell scores of unsuspecting enemies.
From the chariot's elevated platform, archers are offered unparalleled opportunities to fire on the enemy.
Volleys of withering fire reduce any would-be army to a riddled, desperate band.
Watch as the foe throws itself upon these warriors' spears. Those who survive must then face shield and claw.
The charge will fall upon them and be repelled by resolute hands bearing resolute polearms.

Reduces [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero action success chance||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence||Improves [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_ward_save.png]][[/img]]ward saves
The Carrion of the Desert, whose mighty outstretched wings darken the sun on the day of slaughter.

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_damage.png]][[/img]]weapon strength||Improves [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order factionwide||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain
Improves magic item drop chance||Reduces miscast base chance||Improves technology research rate
Put a spear in a man's hand and tell him to brace and he will. He will also hope, and pray.
The Hunter’s javelin takes down the largest of wild beasts, and the most gargantuan of foes.
The harshest of wildernesses creates the most brutal of hunters.
Pure airborne majesty, it brings fire and death as it swoops down over enemy lines.
The Reikland Runefang is the symbol of the Elector Count of this province. It is currently owned by the Prince of Altdorf, Karl Franz.
In battle is the only time a Dragon Ogre can die, so they fight with a powerful fury.
Favoured by Caledor, these raiders bring oblivion to Ulthuan's enemies, by spear-tipped charge.
These archers take aim at the enemies of the Elven kingdom, harassing with arrows whilst screening their allies.
Victims find out too late that the enchanting creature gliding towards them is not a woman, but a savage, rabid beast!
Quest Reward - Revered Spear of Tlanxla
The hardest-hitting mobs in a tribe, Big 'Uns are well placed in melee, where they happily smash their enemies apart.
Named after the Tzeentchian sorcerer who discovered it - the Eye sees almost all, its owner should make use of its prophetic powers.
Quest Reward - The Armour of Morkar
Matured and wise, they savage enemy battlelines with claws and fearsome flames.
The paired weapons of Morathi make the Hag Sorceress extremely deadly in combat.
Savage Orcs alone are a terrifying prospect to face. Add Big 'Uns to the mix and things get really nasty very quickly.
This mystic robe creates a shimmering series of images that match and refract Gelt’s appearance to confuse and befuddle any attacking foe.
As well as commanding bands of Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers form an elite retinue of Nagarythe’s finest to accompany Alith Anar into battle.
Lightly armoured and nimble beyond the ken of most, Clan Eshin's death squads move fast and kill quickly.
With a spear in hand, these men are no heroes, but they are stalwart defenders of their Lord's lands.
Greenskins love chucking fings at the enemy; the rock lobber allows them to throw bigger fings further.

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/modifier_icon_armour_piercing.png]][[/img]]armour-piercing damage||Increases Bonus vs Large & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Reduces own army's recruitment & upkeep {{tr:icon_income}}costs
This Hell-Hammer Cannon has been refined by the Pirate King himself to be one of the most feared artillery pieces in existence.
The Dragon Crown has been worn by the High Kings since the founding of Karaz-a-Karak.
Should the enemy get too close, an Organ Gun can decimate entire ranks with a well timed blast.
All of Nehekhara's gods and goddesses are inscribed along the ancient copper staff, granting Khatep mastery over their latent magical power.

The Lore of Shadows embodies unease and confusion, an ethereal misdirection that leaves victims disorientated and deeply unsettled. Those affected by the “thick grey fog” feel displaced, clumsy, or as if the weight of a thousand unknown burdens lies heavily upon their shoulders.

The Lore of the Wild can wreck terrible devastation on the foe by turning creatures against their handlers. It contains an array of hexes, as well as the ability to summon forth the most monstrous of beasts from the deepest forest enclaves.

The Lore of Vampires is a form of Dark Magic that focuses on the dread art of Necromancy. Spells in this lore can improve and refresh the Undead legions or hex the foe with lashes of dark energy and fell winds.
A gargantuan, annihilative force of nature, unnaturally brought back from death to wreak yet more death.
Chaos Warriors come alive in the midst of bloody battle; thriving on the slaughter of similar foes.
Chaos Warriors come alive in the midst of bloody battle; thriving on the slaughter of similar foes.
Chaos Warriors come alive in the midst of bloody battle; thriving on the slaughter of similar foes.
Broadside cannons for sinking mortal ships are devastating when used in the field, pulverising living flesh and solid walls.
A colossal walking frame of galleon-torn timber, iron, and man-flesh, relentlessly driven by a vortex of deathly energy.
The icy northern reaches of frozen purgatory are haunted by howls of the ravenous.

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_armour.png]][[/img]]armour, [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]attack & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence||Improves chance of Underway interception||Improves [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order locally||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_untainted]][[/img]]Untainted corruption
The Swordsmen form a resolute battle line. Blades in hand, they thrive in melee, at the heart of battle.
These Marauders use a wall of spears to impale their enemies, ever in the hope of Ruinous exaltation.
Spearmen provide the backbone of the Empire's battle line, a defensive row of spears against the enemy charge.
Spearmen provide the backbone of the Empire's battle line, a defensive row of spears against the enemy charge.

The Crown of Sorcery was found in the ruins of Todtheim. Its malign influence has helped Azhag carve a path of destruction throughout the Empire, for the crown whispers advice and grants the wearer the power of Death Magic.
Little humanity remains within the Forsaken, only a desire for battle followed by a furious charge into the fray.

Arkhan the Black is the first and most loyal of the evil Nagash's followers. Arkhan helped lead the coup which brought the arch-necromancer to power, and he was the first, after his lord, to imbibe the Elixir of Life.
This sword, created by Teclis, is charged with crackling energy that rends apart those struck by its shining blade.
Although fury and numbers count for much in a fight, a good shield cannot be overstated.
Angry, teeming rats with spears to overwhelm, defend, and tear enemies from their mounts.
Those who are not gored by the rolling spikes of this beast chariot are thrown to a clumsy, painful demise.
The cornerstone of the Skaven military, less numerous but better trained than the slave class.
The cornerstone of the Skaven military, less numerous but better trained than the slave class.
Like all Middenheimers and men of Ulric, Boris Todbringer never takes a challenge lightly, and so brought total war to the Beastmen and their leader, Khazrak the One Eye.
The pickaxe is not the mightiest Dwarfen weapon, but explosives even things out somewhat.
The pickaxe is not the mightiest Dwarfen weapon, but it serves with relative success in melee.
A stampede of crab-like monsters is all the scarier when accompanied by the hisses and cracks of gunpowder weapons.
An unearthly mixture of wood, metal and bone to savage the foe in rending, powerful strikes.
Quest Reward - Cloak of Molten Metal
Swollen with volatile, noxious gases, their liquefying tissues strain dangerously under rotten and tattered skin.
What’s scarier than being bombarded with skulls from a distance? Why, if they are on fire and screaming in anguish of course!
Walking, rotting Ogre flesh fused with ship debris and sea monsters makes for truly twisted abominations.
Quest Reward - Dragon Crown of Karaz
Great weapons increase the chances that the ambitious, yet lowly, Marauder may ensnare the attention of the Gods.
Marauders are the rank and file of Norscan armies, perfectly placed in the centre of battle, bloodied weapon in hand.
These men did not ask for war, yet it has come all the same. With sword in hand, they fight because they must.

Khatep is the Grand Hierophant of Khemri, the head of the Mortuary Cult's hieratic council, and he alone knows all its secrets and unwritten lore. Khatep is the oldest and wisest of all the Liche Priests and the first member of their order to truly deny death's embrace, if not the ravages of time.
First come the vibrations; next the distant sound of destruction; finally, carnage is unleashed. Good luck.

Reduces [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero action success chance||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence||Improves [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_missile.png]][[/img]]missile resistance
The daughter of Manann himself is the most feared captain in Sartosa, as merciless as an ocean tempest.
Gors may be rank-and-file beasts, but that does not diminish their ferocity on the battlefield.
Gors may be rank-and-file beasts, but that does not diminish their ferocity on the battlefield.

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_damage.png]][[/img]]weapon strength||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Reduces own army's {{tr:icon_money}}recruitment costs||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption
Betrayed and outcast by their peers, they bring savage vengeance to any who cross them.
The twin blades of these spurned Elves are brought to bear with truly brutal results.
The strength of these spiteful warriors is borne out by the horrific power of their weapons.
Unseen on the battlefield, but felt when their deadly darts bring down enemies in their droves.
In amongst the chaos of the fight, Black Coaches build strength, becoming more powerful as their enemies fall.
Elite, hardened warriors, Hammerers thrive amongst the melee with warhammer in hand, smashing the unprepared to pieces.

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]attack & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence||Improves chance of Underway interception||Improves [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order factionwide||Enables [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/immune_to_psychology.png]][[/img]]Immune to Psychology
Unlike other levied citizen militias, the Lothern Sea Guard remain armed and ready at all times.
Unlike other levied citizen militias, the Lothern Sea Guard remain armed and ready at all times.
With power syphoned from the ocean’s Winds, the Dreadfleet commander seeks to drown the mortal world in a tide of death.
Fashioned into the shape of a striking asp, the staff writhes and spits with the spiteful anger of Asaph, Goddess of Vengeance.
In the melee, these men are possessed, packing a decisive punch with a touch of insanity.
These men are possessed, packing a decisive punch with a touch of insanity.
Fell Bats fall upon their enemies in a seething mass; in numbers, they become overwhelming.
Fell Bats fall upon their enemies in a seething mass; in numbers, they become overwhelming.
Fell Bats fall upon their enemies in a seething mass; in numbers, they become overwhelming.
Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_damage.png]][[/img]]weapon strength||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Improves [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order locally
The doom-bringing Krakenlord of Karond Kar fights as naturally as he reads the oceanic temper.
Spoken of for many ages, this Lord of Change is favoured by Tzeentch himself, and fulfils his dark, malicious purpose.
Their charge protected by heavy barding, these mounted warriors wield mighty blades to slash and gore.
Armed with a mighty lance for a powerful charge, then enchanted swords to deliver punishment up close.
An unspeakably powerful weapon once said to have been wielded by the warlike Old One deity, Tlanxla.

Developed over millennia by the Mortuary Cult, this lore invokes the desert gods and includes many augment spells to improve the quality of your skeletal warriors, as well as curse the foe and summon extra recruits from the sands.
With a team of Goblin riders upon its back, the Arachnarok's sheer enormity strikes fear into the hearts of all who face it.
Created by the Arch-Necromancer, the staff harnesses Dark Magic from deep within the accursed Black Pyramid.
Vlad von Carstein is the first and greatest of the Vampire Counts of Sylvania. A master swordsman and skilled general with no small aptitude in the magical arts.
All High Elves, both highborn and low, must defend Ulthuan to the last.
Balthasar Gelt is the Supreme Patriarch of the Colleges of Magic. He has only ever been seen swathed in shimmering, metallic robes and wearing a golden mask.
Over many battles and countless acts of treachery, Chieftain Tretch Craventail of Clan Rictus has proven himself a master of guile.
Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Improves [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order locally
Little more than shuffling bones with swords and spears, Skeletons perform a dutiful, if not exemplary, job in the battle lines.
Little more than shuffling bones with swords and spears, Skeletons perform a dutiful, if not exemplary, job in the battle lines.
The Undead devotees of the Tomb Kings are risen again, unswervingly loyal to their liege.
In the name of Khaine and with draichs in their hands, furious brutality is brought to the battlefield.

The vile, twisted creature known as Morghur is the essence of mutation and corruption given form. His coarse hair is woven through with gibbering, shrieking skulls, and his form flows and reshapes with every passing second.

The Witch King is the supreme ruler of Naggaroth, and the eternal enemy of the High Elves. Long ago, he sought to claim Ulthuan's crown, but the Flames of Asuryan left him scarred by fire and twisted with hatred.

Teclis is Tyrion's twin brother, but two more different siblings would be hard to find. Where the curse of Aenarion has yet to leave an obvious mark upon Tyrion, it has made his brother frail and caustic.
Fast and dependable, an Outrider can be in one place to fire, then be in another to fire again moments later.
Fast and dependable, an Outrider can be in one place to fire, then be in another to fire again moments later.
Spears extend, like gnarled and sharpened bones, held firmly in place by their deathly-grip.

High Magic is far more versatile than other lores as it uses the combined Winds, which is why only Elves and higher lifeforms can cast it. The spells are a powerful mix of defence, support and attack.

Reduces [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero action success chance||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_armour.png]][[/img]]armour||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence||Improves wound recovery time
Increases Battle Wizard capacity||Increases Battle Wizard rank on recruitment||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack
Chosen are greater than their Chaotic brethren, more powerful and savage in close quarters, especially with great weapons.
Chosen are greater than their Chaotic brethren, more powerful and savage in close quarters, especially with great weapons.
Chosen are greater than their Chaotic brethren, more powerful and savage at close-quarters, especially with great weapons.
This charmed helmet, fashioned from the skull of a slaughtered foe, protects Tretch from blows of all kinds, be they physical or magical.
These wise, winged bastions of the forest will see it defended, as they have done for countless centuries.
A Centigor charges the enemy battle line, great weapon in hand, delivering oblivion to its foes.
Though clumsy, Centigors can still lodge a throwing axe deep into an enemy skull from afar.
Hybrid man-beasts, raging at fate, Centigors bring their anger to bear upon anything in their path.

Durthu is an Elder of Athel Loren, a Treeman so ancient that even Ariel's millenia-long existence pales in comparison. It was he who first forged a union between Elves and forest, and he also who argued with his fellow Elders that the binding be made permanent.
Khazrak embodies the rage of the Beastmen. Hunger for war, for flesh and, most of all, for revenge drives his journey across the great blood-grounds, at the head of the brayherd.
There is no bargaining when the forest is damaged; vengeance will be exacted.
Amidst a churning cloud of heaved-up sand, these Undead warriors charge their foes with supernatural determination.

The Lore of Heavens manipulates the forces of the sky, harnessing destructive weather or drawing upon the predictive power of astrology to alter probabilities - it's particularly effective against flying enemies.
The Staff of Volans has ever been the symbol of the Supreme Patriarch's office, allowing Gelt to bend the Winds of Magic to his will.

The Lore of Beasts is dominated by augment spells that grant your warriors extra abilities on the battlefield. It’s a Lore for armies that favour close combat, as a few timely spells can transform mediocre troops into fearsome victors.
Monsters of mutated chaos, these altered beasts rain savage blows upon the foe.
Thorgrim Grudgebearer is the current High King of the Dwarfs. He is a throwback to the High Kings of old - eager for new conquests, mighty in battle, and a merciless enemy.
Those able to ride Cold Ones charge headlong into enemy lines, thrashing with crude but effective clubs.
The sword burns away the flesh of Arkhan's victims, leaving nothing but a charred skeleton, bound to the Liche King's dark will for all eternity.

Volkmar the Grim is the head of the Cult of Sigmar and the most powerful religious leader in the Empire. He is a pious and foreboding man, utterly devoted to the destruction of Chaos in all its forms.
Hollow-eyed murderers, the Doomfire Warlocks must loosen the grip of Slaanesh with the blood of others.

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Reduces own army's {{tr:icon_money}}recruitment costs||Reduces own army's upkeep {{tr:icon_money}}costs
From horseback, these Yeomen bring death across the battlefield to where it's needed most.
Archery from horseback is fast and dangerous to the enemy, who have little time to react.
Archaon the Everchosen is the Lord of the End Times, the vessel through which the Dark Gods unite their followers and turn the whole world into a Realm of Chaos.

1. Spell Upgrade: whether a spell is selected or upgraded.||2. Power: the amount of power that can be used at one time.||3. Power Reserve: As power reserves deplete, the recharge rate decreases.||4. Recharge Rate: the speed at which magical power regenerates.
The victims of a Minotaur are ripped limb from limb and then, unfortunately, devoured.
A ferocious hunger drives axe-wielding Minotaurs into the melee - hunger for war and hunger for flesh.
A ferocious hunger drives axe-wielding Minotaurs into the melee - hunger for war and hunger for flesh.
A well-placed kennel of Warhounds, set loose on the enemy, can thread horrific injury amongst the enemy.

Dark Magic was first pioneered by Morathi herself and discovered by pulling apart the Winds of Magic. It is a spiteful collection of offensive and deadly spells, the casting of which will eventually cost the user their soul.
Terrifyingly ravenous mockeries of life, bound into monstrous groups with arcane spells.

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Reduces own army's {{tr:icon_money}}recruitment costs||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]Vampiric corruption

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_damage.png]][[/img]]weapon strength||Improves post-battle chance of stealing a magic item||Reduces [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]corruption||Enables [[img:ui/skins/default/modifier_icon_poison.png]][[/img]]poison attacks
Firm allies for millennia, these majestic birds aid the Elves by swooping onto enemy lines and clawing them apart.
Though temperamental and difficult to control, a Troll is a whirling ball of difficult-to-kill death.
The Emerald Gate - one of the wonders of the Old World - is guarded only by the best of the best.
{{tr:hp_battle_point_1_spells}}||{{tr:hp_battle_point_2_spells}}||Wind and breath spells can be directed by holding the left mouse button and dragging.

Wurrzag’s power and influence are beyond question. Those that know his abilities obey; those who do not, suffer. His retinue of Savage Orcs has vowed to stand by ‘Da Great Green Prophet’ to the end, and their strength has inspired countless other Greenskins to war in their turn.
With axe-flinging Marauders in tow, drooling and crazed Ice Wolves can pull chariots with overwhelming speed.
Quest Reward - Sword of Unholy Power
Quest Reward - Cobra Mace of Mazdamundi
Careening across the battlefield, smashing everything on contact and incinerating anything too close with bolts of savage Warpstone lightning.

Skarsnik is a meddlesome and cunning Night Goblin, preferring to taunt and torment his opponents rather than swiftly killing them. Ever the sneakiest of his kind, he leads his forces on feints and duplicitous manoeuvres that leave his enemies bewildered, beleaguered, and - eventually - destroyed.

Settra the Imperishable is the King of all Tomb Kings. He is a ruthless leader whose thirst for conquest knows no bounds. Settra's power is far greater than any other Tomb King, and his unyielding will is such that he never needs to return to his sarcophagus to rest.
From atop enormous and reverent Stegadons, their crew fire enormous bolts from giant crossbows, decimating enemy ranks.
These mighty savages are armed and armoured by design; woe betide any being who encroaches on their territory!
The Manticore is a killer, above all. Born of Chaos, mutations and madness, but a killer all the same.
The perfect shock troop smashes into enemy lines, devastating their confidence by inflicting many casualties.
The Necrolith Colossi are great bestriding monuments, often in the shape of hulking skeletons.
Ever seeking vengeance, these hardy Rangers follow their Brewmaster, delivering grim tidings of upcoming struggles and bolstering the Dwarfs’ defensive lines.

Prince Tyrion is the High Elves’ greatest living warrior. So valiant and skilled is he that the bards of Ulthuan sing that he is nothing less than Aenarion reborn - a tale that is given credence far beyond Ulthuan's shores.
Quest Reward - The Tomb Blade of Arkhan
A furious battlefield force; savage in combat and notoriously difficult to kill.
Ungors are more nimble than their brethren, useful for flanking foes and harassing with spears.
With shields in hand, these Ungors can engage the enemy and hold their own thereafter.
Developed by Clan Skryre, these poisoned-wind globes contain an even more virulent strain of deadly gas.
Reduces [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]corruption||Improves magic item drop chance||Increases Winds of Magic power reserve

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Reduces own army's {{tr:icon_money}}recruitment costs||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption
Trained to trample on command, a Mammoth can easily reduce enemies to a bloody ground-smear.

The Lore of Beasts is dominated by augment spells that grant your warriors extra abilities on the battlefield. It’s a Lore for armies that favour close combat, as a few timely spells can transform mediocre troops into fearsome victors.

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_armour.png]][[/img]]armour||Improves [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_physical.png]][[/img]]physical resistance||Improves chance of Underway interception
The path to Ruinous glory is strewn with the butchered remains of those who fell by the wayside.
This stave is imbued with the right to lead, so that power and authority pervades its holder.

Reduces [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero action success chance||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_armour.png]][[/img]]armour & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence||Improves [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_ward_save.png]][[/img]]ward saves||Improves wound recovery time
The Spells of Ruin are a fell mix of harrowing offensive attacks, short-range relocation for 'brave' withdrawals, and augments that can rile your own warriors into a deadly frenzy.
A spear may mean they fight a little longer or better, but it only delays their inevitable demise.
A dark cloak that swirls and twists with a life of its own.
Quest Reward - Dragon Cloak of Fyrskar
The Warpstone-infused armour plates of Queek Headtaker are as spiteful as their owner.
Walls are nothing to the blast of Trebuchet fire, and a man's skull fares even worse.

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_damage.png]][[/img]]weapon strength||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Reduces own army's {{tr:icon_money}}recruitment costs||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption
This radiant golden totem generates a golden globe of power that shields those within from harm.
In this lawless, miserable world the weak, or the merely out-manoeuvred, are either killed or put to back-breaking toil by the strong.
They can burrow for leagues when summoned, bursting into battle with a blast of sand and snapping limbs.
Served by the reanimated corpses of shipwrecked unfortunates, the Pirate King is a plague upon the world’s seas.
Longbeards are veteran fighters of many wars, rending armour with the two-handed az and cleaving opponents in two.
When hoping for the fleeting, fickle favour of the Ruinous Ones, carry a really big mace.
Cyclopean fiends, degenerate and malign, ever-vying for the attention of the Dark Gods.
Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack||Improves own army's casualty replenishment rate||Reduces own army's upkeep {{tr:icon_money}}costs
This vicious beast carries a warshrine aloft, carrying blasphemous icons and unholy relics to battle in sight of the Chaos Gods.
Helblaster Guns eviscerate opposition from a distance with a ceaseless shower of black powder fire.
The Irondrakes wield drake guns, firing bursts of alchemical fury onto anyone in their path.
These Irondrakes wield drakeguns that fire the deadly Trollhammer Torpedo - a spiky cone of death - at unfortunate foes.
A loathsome beast of uncharted depths possessing colossal strength and insatiable hunger.
Beneath the fortress of boughs, Athel Loren is defended with blood.
The spear and shield of the Wood Elves, seldom bested in combat.
This deadly weapon fires in the blink of an eye, leaving gaping holes and scorched earth in its wake.

The Lore of Death has a formidable battery of lethal damage spells for zapping enemy characters. Death Magic can be more destructive even than Fire Magic, but is also surprisingly varied with hexes and an augment spell as well, making Shyish-users more than mere Pyromancers.
The Brimstone Gun gives the Gyrocopter pilot a more accurate and lethal tool, ideal for obliterating the target completely!
The skilled Gyrocopter pilot unleashes jets of steam upon unprepared battle lines.
Death's true face radiates sinister magic; the cruel laughter of ancient gods echoes within its shadow.
A pack of Cold Ones, ridden with skill, can charge powerfully into melee and remain there for some time.
After being forged under Red Eye Mountain, this armour was cooled with the blood of Dwarf Runesmiths.
Following the death of his family from the Plague of Blue Roses, Helman Ghorst plunged himself into the study of the black arts, hoping to return his brothers to life.
A product of twisted sorcery, this construct fuses with the wearer, giving him tremendous endurance.
The Lizardmen elite, charged to defend their sacred grounds, skewering interlopers at the end of their halberds.
The Shaggoth tower over the common man, casting fearsome shadows matched only by the seismic devastation they cause.
The Grail Knights charge the enemy line with a furious stampede of hooves and the Lady in their thoughts.
Scuttling across the battlefield, these killer arthropods want nothing less than to dismember and decapitate anything that comes near.
The bigger the blade, the greater the chance the fickle, Dark Gods will notice the aspiring Champion.
All Champions strive to be chosen, willing their deeds to be observed and judged.
These cursed items are all manner of blasphemy, from skulls of dead priests to hallowed, torn branches of Loren.
Defeat and conquest, at the end of a quarrel.
The cut and thrust of melee is child's play to those trained on tumultuous seas.
Plagued by visions, Cygors are cursed to see the Winds of Chaos. Naturally, this makes them mad and extremely dangerous.
Ghal Maraz is the legendary hammer of Sigmar. This rune-encrusted weapon is not only the symbol of the Emperor's mantle, but one of the most potent artefacts in the world.

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_armour.png]][[/img]]armour, [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_ward_save.png]][[/img]]ward saves and [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_fire.png]][[/img]]fire resistance||Improves wound recovery time||Reduces [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero action success chance
Quest Reward - Cloak of Mists and Shadows

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]attack & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence||Reduces own army's upkeep {{tr:icon_money}}costs||Improves chance of Underway interception||Increases horde growth
Quest Reward - The Blessed Blade of Ptra
The trebuchet - far superior to the catapult - hurls thrice-blessed stones at the enemy, crushing them with devout fury.
Grombrindal, The White Dwarf, is a legendary figure - the mightiest living Dawi warrior.

The Lore of Metal is based around the manipulation and transformation of metals. As you might expect, enemies that rely heavily on armour should beware the Lore of Metal, as its spells either ignore armour or turn it against its wearer, with horrendous consequences.
A monolithic force of destruction on the battlefield - each tremendous footstep crushing many foolish warriors underfoot.

The Lore of the Wild can wreck terrible devastation on the foe by turning creatures against their handlers. It contains an array of hexes, as well as the ability to summon forth the most monstrous of beasts from the deepest forest enclaves.
Although new, and therefore suspect, a Thunderer's handgun can punch through the heaviest of armour at short range.
Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_damage.png]][[/img]]weapon strength||Increases casualties captured post-battle
Increases Necromancer rank on recruitment||Improves magic item drop chance||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]Vampiric corruption
The High Elves' chief artillery piece can mow down infantry and pierce Giants' hearts.
Alarielle the Radiant, High Priestess of Isha and Everqueen of Ulthuan.
The heinous combination of a Fell Bat and a gun-wielding zombie makes for a hideous, flying horror.
The heinous combination of a Fell Bat and a gun-wielding zombie makes for a hideous, flying horror.
Beware the Deck Droppers’ black powder bombs released indiscriminately – if somewhat inaccurately – from above!
Da Big Waaagh! is as unsubtle as you can get. It is a lore full of big, bruising spells that often include the participation of the Green Gods, Gork and Mork, themselves.
An ancient battle-helm dating back to the time of Morkar, the Crown of Domination exudes an aura of raw malice, cowing the unruly servants of Chaos and terrifying the enemy.

Life and nature are inextricably linked, when not corrupted by the venomous tendrils of eternal darkness. Life magic is therefore focused on healing and regeneration; the followers of Ghyran use their powers to heal rifts and mend that which is broken, slowing the advancing tide of Chaotic madness and death.

Improves magic item drop chance||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack||Improves [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_magic.png]][[/img]]magic resistance||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]Vampiric corruption
The holy relics of the Lady, the most sacred in all Bretonnia, are guarded by the most fervent and fearsome of warriors.
Savage Orc Arrer Boyz aren't always precise but remain deadly. Precisely deadly, you might say.
Mannfred is no slave to conventions of honour or glory. Ends concern him far more than means; if the choice falls between slaughtering the meek and vanquishing the mighty, he chooses slaughter.
Feeling no pain, they throw themselves into battle, paying little heed to what awaits them.
Skin Wolves take to the battlefield to glut themselves on the raw and dripping gore of their victims.
The half-feral, gore-obsessed Skin Wolves, armoured so their slaughter may continue unabated.

The Lore of Shadows embodies unease and confusion, an ethereal misdirection that leaves victims disorientated and deeply unsettled. Those affected by the “thick grey fog” feel displaced, clumsy, or as if the weight of a thousand unknown burdens lies heavily upon their shoulders.

The Lore of Heavens manipulates the forces of the sky, harnessing destructive weather or drawing upon the predictive power of astrology to alter probabilities - it's particularly effective against flying enemies.

The Lore of Light can broadly be described as protective magic, granting defensive bonuses to your troops. This is why it is also known as Guardian Magic, and why White Wizards are so sought after by canny generals.
Mighty, hulking reptiles, these 'Living Bastions' are wild and untamed. Better watch out!
Carried atop the mightiest of beasts, the Revivification Crystal regenerates and heals combat-damaged units.
The Solar Engine can disintegrate enemies with a beam of pure sunlight.

Reduces [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero action success chance||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_armour.png]][[/img]]armour||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence||Improves wound recovery time
Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Improves [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order factionwide
Forged in Vaul's Anvil, worn by Aenarion until his death, and only a few of Ulthuan's gloried heroes since.
Seldom seen outside the walls of the White Tower, the War Crown was given to Teclis by the former High Loremaster and holds great power.
An ancestral ring, set with a gem of deep, sanguine claret, that has granted the von Carsteins everlasting Undeath.
Though not noble or powerful like Knights, these men take great honour to take up arms in defence of home.
Though not noble or powerful like Knights, these men take great honour to take up arms in defence of home.
Malagor is swift, as if riding the very Winds of Magic. His every step and word boils with corruption, and the Bray-Shamans who serve him carry out their horrific work with increased fervour.
The jaws of the Skull Staff chatter and gnash, warning Kemmler of baleful magic in his vicinity.
The vile cantrips written within the mouldering pages of the Liber Bubonicus are powerful indeed.
Though mocked by stronger beasts, Ungors nevertheless instil fear as they charge the foe down.
With stout shields and resolute temperaments, resisting the charge of any who dare stand against them.
The stuff of legend, devastating enemy lines with a staggering charge.
A weapon created to kill the Dwarf-things, it perfectly suits Queek’s furious windmill style of attack.

The newly-elected Emperor is Karl Franz, Prince of Altdorf and Elector Count of Reikland. Franz is already garnering a reputation as a great statesman and warrior but has yet to prove himself as sovereign.
Azhag is a threat like no other. What makes Azhag so unusual is his ominous iron crown, which emanates an ancient evil. It is this crown, a relic of olden days, which grants Azhag sorcerous powers.
Forged by the Witch King, the blade’s merest touch can unmake enchantments and wither minds.
The Pistoliers are standard missile cavalry, their pistols packing an effective punch whilst maintaining mobility.
Their great weapons are wielded as expertly as they did in life, slaying for Lord and glory!
These guards' loyalty in life was rewarded; now they are expected to show it once more.
From a position of relative safety, slings enable them to watch their peers march to their doom.
True to their name, they wither their enemies with volleys of black-tipped arrows.
True to their name, they wither their enemies with volleys of black-tipped arrows.
The Warriors of Nehekhara remember only their duty to their king, and pursue his enemies with ruthless purpose.
Giants attack the enemy in a rage, with flailing limbs that break both man and machine apart.
Horse-born leaders, their powerful steeds a symbol of dread status before the Dark Gods.
Bolts of cleansing energy fly from the Wizard’s hands, searing evil wherever they strike.
Hoeth-forged steel cries out as its wielders lunge into battle, cutting down foe after foe with their greatswords.
Orion is the King of Athel Loren and consort of the Mage Queen, Ariel. Although all Elves are long-lived, he is immortal - calling the Wild Hunt each year in defence of the sacred forest.
Monstrous, mutated and savage, a Crypt Horror is devastating to the enemy frontline.
Rifles afford better accuracy, which can be advantageous for the clumsy hands of the rotting Undead.

Warlord Queek Headtaker is the right claw to Warlord Gnawdwell, grand ruler of Clan Mors and member of the Council of Thirteen. That Queek has risen so high in arguably the most powerful Warlord clan is a credit to the terrible violence he unleashes on any in his way.
The random discharge of noisy, indiscriminate firepower gives the Gunnery Mob a small spark of satisfaction enjoyed in life.
Undead minions have no fear of blowing themselves up, making them ideal gunpowder-keg-launchers!
Where marksmanship might be lacking, a more powerful firearm will usually suffice.
When deadly Asrai spears are wielded, the war dance is an intricate performance ending in the foes' death.
Floating and weaving through the battle line; an expressive demonstration of violence.
Ariel's handmaidens know only the defence of their Queen and the forest - an eternal duty, never forsworn.
The strongest, meanest Beastmen, Bestigors seek out elite foes to slaughter and dominate.
Greatest of all the Brides of Khaine, the many ways of murder are Hellebron's to command.
A lumbering Giant is the terror of the battlefield, smashing entire ranks of men aside and feasting on the less fortunate ones.
A Giant is possessed of immense strength, and is devastatingly powerful when unleashed upon the opposition's battle line.
Skeletal steeds instinctively obey the will of their riders, displaying the same supernatural discipline.
These Skinks are trained to hurl javelins true enough to blunt a charging foe.
The diligent workforce of the Lizardmen Empire, good for throwing into melee as fodder.
Quest Reward - Dragon Armour of Aenarion

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_damage.png]][[/img]]weapon strength||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Improves [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order locally
The Sisters of Slaughter are creatures of instinct, impossible to predict and unfathomably deadly.

The Lore of Fire has its basis in powerful ranged attack spells, designed to wreak massive damage on your foes. If you see your Wizards as essentially 'magical artillery' then the Lore of Fire is probably the one for you.

Before the loss of the Eight Peaks, Belegar’s Ancestors were the kings of the nigh-impregnable fortress for many generations. The Angrund Clan is steeped in centuries of military understanding and has a keen eye for the particulars of siege warfare.
Agile and swift beyond measure, these mounted warriors' missiles spell doom for their opponents.
A Chaos Chariot is a terrifying thing to slam into an enemy line, punching through with maddening strength.
Extremely effective in battle, the Cairn Wraith has no corporeal form, making it extremely difficult to kill with conventional weaponry.
A Chaos Chariot is a terrifying thing to slam into an enemy line, punching through with maddening strength.
These men did not ask for war, yet it has come all the same. With sword in hand, they fight because they must.
The Spells of Ruin are a fell mix of harrowing offensive attacks, short-range relocation for 'brave' withdrawals, and augments that can rile your own warriors into a deadly frenzy.

This lore summons the ocean’s deepest lurkers as well as augmenting those that give thanks to Manann and Stromfels by using arcane currents to disrupt the enemy or improve the proficiency of those that have salt-water in their lungs.
Night Goblins raid with efficiency; they swarm and ambush, cutting their foes apart.
One incensed Squig is enough trouble. For whosoever attracts their ire, an entire herd conjures a nightmare!
This accursed blade drinks deep of its victim's blood, restoring vigour and strength to the one who brandishes it.
Hideously mutated and filled with hungry rage, Razorgors tear men apart in their search for food.
Bolstering the fighting spirit of all those around it and blasting enemy ranks with savage, dark energy.
The rarest of all steeds, only the most noble of Bretonnians ride these dignified, sophisticated creatures into battle.
No ordinary armour would suit a Warboss such as Azhag, it had to be ‘ard - really, really ‘ard.
Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_armour.png]][[/img]]armour||Increases Winds of Magic power reserve||Reduces cooldown on all spells||Increases Mage capacity & rank on recruitment
Prideful - and all the more deadly for it - the Boar Boyz deal grizzly death from atop their mounts.
It takes a certain kind of insanity to ride a rage-frothed Squig and bounce into the fray.
Preferred lore of Plague Priests, the Spells of Plague are a vile selection that can hurt a lot of the enemy at once. Perfect for when you’re facing hordes of lightly-armoured troops.
The Knights ride down their enemies with a thunderous charge and a cry of valour.
The flail of Skrolk is a rusted, pitted ball of miasma that spreads poxes as it is swung.
Quest Reward - War Crown of Saphery
The greatest Bretonnian leader since Gilles the Uniter, King Louen is a mighty warrior-king – the very pinnacle of Knightly perfection.

Reduces own army's {{tr:icon_money}}recruitment costs||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_damage.png]][[/img]]weapon strength when fighting against Dwarfs||Adds [[img:ui/skins/default/modifier_icon_bonus_vs_infantry.png]][[/img]]Bonus vs. Infantry
[[img:icon_ap_ranged]][[/img]]Armour-Piercing Missiles||Good Range||Decent Melee Combatant||Bows of Avelorn
Crypt Ghouls are barely sentient but they can fight, using their claws and makeshift weapons to rip men apart.
An erratic flurry of explosive airborne destruction - Helstorm rockets are extremely powerful, if extremely unreliable, weapons from the Imperial arsenal.
The Axe of Dargo, a runic weapon of monstrous size, is tempered with dragon's blood and iron-oaths of vengeance.
Up close, a Troll will batter foes into submission, or vomit disgusting, and potentially corrosive, bile across the field.
Fast and nimble, dodging enemy fire to deliver incisive hit-and-run charges to enemy lines.
Their shields ensure that these riders can get in amongst the fray and remain there.
Being everywhere and nowhere is their signature skill, with volleys of fire to harass the foe.
The bond between the Elves and the Hawks is unbreakable.
Crazed by poisonous concoctions, their dual daggers lacerate and shred for the Bloody-handed God.
Even the most heinous green-skinned scumbags look upon these Goblins' swift skulduggery with reverent horror.
Once belonging to the First Chosen of Chaos, this ancient suit of Chaos Armour is as powerful as those who have dared to don it.
Schooled in slaughter through a lifetime of survival.
Although diminutive by Beastmen standards, Ungors are both faster and more nimble than others of their kind.

Reduces [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero action success chance||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence||Improves [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_magic.png]][[/img]]magic resistance||Increases [[img:icon_corruption_untainted]][[/img]]Untainted corruption
Atop their venomous mounts, Goblin Riders can run down enemies with surprising precision.
Atop their venomous mounts, Goblin Riders can run down enemies with surprising precision.
This shield has a reflection so dark that it absorbs hostile magic and reflects it back at the foe.
The weight of their ancestry is carried with them, skewering all-comers on their bloody lances.
Bigger than normal Orcs, and stronger too, the Orc Boar Big 'Uns ride their beasts into enemy lines, devastating all who face them.
The Auric Armour is a sculpted suit forged from ensorcelled gold. Tendrils of dark energy caress the skin of the wearer, closing his wounds with a tender touch.
The holder of secrets and keeper of the way, whose strength is the quester's ultimate test.
Though temperamental and difficult to control, a Troll is a whirling ball of difficult-to-kill death.
Stalwart defenders of the crypts, Grave Guards possess a fighting skill beyond that of the usual wights.
Stalwart defenders of the crypts, Grave Guards possess a fighting skill beyond that of the usual wights.
A piercing scream, a swooping shadow upon the water – a dead body drained of blood.
The Eternal Challenger is bound to a lifetime of constant duelling and violent killing.
Kholek is a Shaggoth of tremendous age. He is one of the first-born kin of Krakanrok the Black, father of the Dragon Ogres. Where the Herald of the Tempest walks, a raging storm blots out the sun.
When a poisoned globe explodes, anyone caught in its radius is guaranteed to die a painful, pus-ridden death.
Much rarer than other Cold Ones, these virtually-extinct Lustrian warriors fight with preternatural swiftness that belies their size.

The Lore of Death has a formidable battery of lethal damage spells for zapping enemy characters. Death Magic can be more destructive even than Fire Magic, but is also surprisingly varied with hexes and an augment spell as well, making Shyish-users more than mere Pyromancers.
The Blood Knights of the sea are elite, armour-clad sentries to the dreaded seafaring creatures of the night.
The only thing scarier than a Depth Guard is one with a weapon that gives it an eight-foot reach.
The very image of madness and ruin; the ultimate rat-made menace unleashed.
Stronger and faster than the mightiest warhorse, the Pegasus Knight swoops across the battlefield with a powerful airborne charge.
Tethered to their mounts by a sharp hook, the other mummified hand wields a barbed staff to carve through mortal flesh.
Galloping to war with Orion, his personal guard bring a calamity to all who stand against them.
Each serpentine steed is spurred to acts of great brutality in the name of the king.
Galloping to war with Orion, his personal guard bring a calamity to all who stand against them.
Although a fierce foe to Bretonnia's enemies, Knights should be wary of their kleptomaniac tendencies…
Recognisably dark-furred, the Skaven military elite fight with a proud zeal unique to their class.
Recognisably dark-furred, the Skaven military elite fight with a proud zeal unique to their class.
When the skies are dark and the need is great, these noble avians come to the aid of their Elven friends.
Flame Cannons belch burning pitch across the battlefield, raining molten death upon the enemy.

Reduces [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero action success chance||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_armour.png]][[/img]]armour & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence||Improves [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_ward_save.png]][[/img]]ward saves||Improves wound recovery time
Charged to defend the Phoenix King to the last, they cut their opponents down with their savage great axes.
Quest Reward - The Crown of Nehekhara
The Deckhands’ polearms are rusty extensions of the decomposing arms that brandish them.
These Undead mariners are competent crewmen and relentless fighters, making them ideal pirates.
A pack of Wolf Riders can appear from nowhere, strike with precision, and be away before the enemy knows what has happened.
A pack of Wolf Riders can appear from nowhere, strike with precision, and be away before the enemy knows what has happened.
Da Big Waaagh! is as unsubtle as you can get. It is a lore full of big, bruising spells that often include the participation of the Green Godz, Gork and Mork, themselves.
The diving Terrorgheist, with a terrifying scream, seeds death and havoc amongst its enemies.
Trained to fight in tight formations, Ironbreakers form a living line of defence, letting enemies crash over them.

Reduces [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero action success chance||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_armour.png]][[/img]]armour & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence||Improves [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_ward_save.png]][[/img]]ward saves||Improves wound recovery time
Although inaccurate, Peasant Bowmen provide a cheap, plentiful line of defence against the oncoming enemy.

Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack & [[img:ui/skins/default/modifier_icon_armour_piercing.png]][[/img]]armour-piercing damage||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Improves [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]public order locally
Wading into battle, crazed and unable to be broken, they face their doom with furious acceptance.

This lore summons the ocean’s deepest lurkers as well as augmenting those that give thanks to Manann and Stromfels by using arcane currents to disrupt the enemy or improve the proficiency of those that have salt-water in their lungs.
With az in hand, Dwarfen warriors lay into the front lines with unremitting violence.
With az in hand, Dwarfen warriors lay into the front lines with unremitting violence.
The bulk of Dark Elf armies, with spears as unwavering as their pride.
The spear is a solid weapon; piercing and defensive. Goblins, however…
The Troll King seeks to grind the realms of civilisation under his monstrous rule.
Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/modifier_icon_armour_piercing.png]][[/img]]armour-piercing damage||Increases {{tr:icon_income}}post-battle loot gain||Reduces own army's upkeep {{tr:icon_money}}costs
Crypt Ghouls are barely sentient but they can fight, using their claws and makeshift weapons to rip men apart.
These secretive warriors work best when deployed away from the main host, striking at flanks and unsecured or vulnerable places.
Appearing as if from the earth itself, peppering opponents with relentless, deadly sling-fire.

Though he appears to be little more than sixteen summers of age, Sigvald the Magnificent has blighted the world for over three hundred years; the personification of beauty on the outside, but rot within.
The gigantic warhammer known as Starcrusher was forged in the raging heart of a volcano. Kholek wields this enormous weapon with staggering brutality and skill despite its size.
A figure of awe and influence, the Fay Enchantress is the Lady’s personal representative and, some say, the true power in Bretonnia.
Zombie pirate crews love dragging a big gun into a fight, no matter how unwieldy it might be!
You'll never find a less trustworthy rabble, but for the right price they'll find to the death... and beyond.
The living are scythed down as these nightmarish beasts glide and bound amongst their helpless, terrified prey.
Though temperamental and difficult to control, a Troll is a whirling ball of difficult-to-kill death.

Dark Magic was first pioneered by Morathi herself and discovered by pulling apart the Winds of Magic. It is a spiteful collection of offensive and deadly spells, the casting of which will eventually cost the user their soul.
A Savage Orc, atop his boar, delivers a powerful charge then remains a mighty, fearful presence at the heart of the battle.
Goblin Archers can pepper the enemy from afar, with varying success.

The Lore of Vampires is a form of Dark Magic that focuses on the dread art of Necromancy. Spells in this lore can improve and refresh the Undead legions or hex the foe with lashes of dark energy and fell winds.
An eldritch horror, the mad thrashing of its unnatural limbs sends all to their doom.
These sentinels mark the borders of the Tomb Kings' realm, submerged in the sand, waiting to strike at the unsuspecting.
Those who enter Athel Loren without permission must answer for such a transgression.
Chaos Knights deliver a terrifyingly powerful charge to enemy lines, particularly if armed with a lance.
Chaos Knights deliver a terrifyingly powerful charge to enemy lines, particularly if armed with a lance.
Slayers are elite units with a thirst for death, fighting hard in melee until the enemy dies, or they do.
Quest Reward - Sunburst Standard of Hexoatl
A volley of Dwarfen crossbow bolts will travel far and hit hard, particularly against the lightly armoured.
Though these Dwarfs excel at a distance, it would be foolhardy to underestimate them in melee.
Raining arrows from a distance is the preferred Greenskin tactic.
The Flag of the Blood Keep flashes violently; the Blood Knights run their enemies down.
Atop their skeletal steeds, Black Knights destroy enemy battle lines with powerful cavalry charges.
Atop their skeletal steeds, Black Knights destroy enemy battle lines with powerful cavalry charges.

The Lore of Light can broadly be described as protective magic, granting defensive bonuses to your troops. This is why it is also known as Guardian Magic, and why White Wizards are so sought after by canny generals.
Well-armoured and resplendent, the Knights deliver a fierce and destructive charge.
Poison, horns, claws and teeth; a myriad ways to destroy the foe.
Protected by powerful runes, the Armour of Skaldour has turned countless blades against the High King in both battle and from assassination.
He follows those who wage war for the Dark Gods – their killing fields are his feeding grounds.
A thundering mix of beast and machine to harass enemy battlelines from range before crushing them at the charge.
Quest Reward - Amulet of Sea Gold
This majestic, horned helmet has been worn by every Slayer King since the time of King Baragor.
Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_defence.png]][[/img]]melee defence & missile parry in radius
Enables Lore of Death||Improves ambushing success chance||Increases Underway evasion chance
Their howls turn even the bravest sailors stark white, spearing their souls like a lance through the heart.
Devilish chariots imbued with dark and eldritch power, driving the Undead to greater, more macabre acts.
Infernal flames belch from dismal braziers, permeating the air with fragments of magic-confounding Warpstone.
When the lodestone bell rings, dark magic exudes and ripples across the battlefield.
Guardians of the sacred places of Avelorn, these peerless archers are incorruptible.
This decrepit tome bristles with dark secrets and eldritch powers. Reading from it summons dark thoughts and grim deeds.
This small idol shimmers with an eerie green light, bestowing unnatural regenerative powers upon the wearer.
A staple of Dwarfen armies, the cannon is a long-ranged, powerful weapon essential to the Dwarfen grand strategy.
The most junior of Knights, they fight determinedly to make a name for themselves.

There are few kinds of monsters walking the world that Ungrim Ironfist has not slain in battle. Ungrim deals death - carving a path of red ruin before him while singing songs of old in a booming voice.
More rudimentary than other Dwarf artillery, but nevertheless ruthlessly proficient at destroying their foes.
The Empire's standard, effective cannonry sends armour-piercing iron balls ploughing through enemy ranks with devastating aplomb.
What a Mortar may lack in sheer stopping power compared to cannons, it makes up with pure vicious, explosive destruction.
More rudimentary than the cannon, a Grudge Thrower is still an effective long-range weapon against enemy infantry.
In many ways, these warriors define the armies of Athel Loren - their bows and blades are at the forefront of any action.
From afar, Arrer Boyz rain down arrows upon their enemies. Accuracy be damned, quantity is all.
The noble-born warriors of the Empire fight in Knightly Orders, heroic brotherhoods who ride into battle atop mighty barded warhorses.
Increases Plague Priest capacity||Improves [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_attack.png]][[/img]]melee attack & [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_damage.png]][[/img]]weapon strength
Great warriors and doomseekers who have unsuccessfully found death thus far... even against Giants.
This ancient suit of chainmail can counter the fanciful enchantments and magicks of enemy blades.
The interred remains of Knights are defended violently by those whose existence gives them purpose.
Understanding from the outset that yours is a suicide mission focuses the murine mind on the murderous task at hand.
At the heart of the battle, in the thickest fighting, highly-trained and utterly silent.
With savage claws and malicious temperament, to rip through enemies with grim delight.
The Witch King is defended, at halberd-point, from those who would do him harm. Imagine such a thing!

High Magic is far more versatile than other lores as it uses the combined Winds, which is why only Elves and higher lifeforms can cast it. The spells are a powerful mix of defence, support and attack.
Every Squire dreams of becoming a Knight, and every Knight dreams of having a better Squire…
Driven not by skill, but by a desire to feast on flesh, zombies are good, terrifying fodder in melee.

Da Little Waaagh! is a sneaky, cunning and nasty lore practiced by even nastier Goblin Shamans. The spells are vindictive, lacking the punch of the ‘bigga magicks’ used by Orcs, but can be no less effective due to their sustained effects.
It is said Prince Sigvald’s ornate sword is forged from a sliver of Slaanesh’s own blade.

The Lore of Metal is based around the manipulation and transformation of metals. As you might expect, enemies that rely heavily on armour should beware the Lore of Metal, as its spells either ignore armour or turn it against its wearer, with horrendous consequences.
This ancient Elven heirloom glows with protective energies that become increasingly more powerful in the presence of evil sorcery.
What a Mortar may lack in sheer stopping power compared to cannons, it makes up with pure vicious, explosive destruction.
